I have no problem with this set-up. The g file is open and the extra f pawn is useful in pressuring the center and keeping knights at bay. The downside is a loose king position and an isolated h pawn.

With this move, he offered a draw and I accepted. After taking back the pawn, there might have followed an exchange of rooks with his knight going to c6, but then ...Nc8 pretty much ends his counterlpay.
